content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>EPA Region 6</origin> <pubdate>5/2006</pubdate> <title>Nonattainment Areas in Louisiana, Geographic NAD83, EPA (2006) [Nonattainment_LA_EPA_2006]</title> <geoform>vector digital data</geoform> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Dallas, TX</pubplace> <publish>EPA Region 6</publish> </pubinfo> <onlink>http://lagic.lsu.edu/data/losco/Nonattainment_LA_EPA_2006.zip</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract> EPA Region 6 NonAttainment Areas in Louisiana, current as of May 2006. This shapefile contains parish boundaries and attributes that determine whether the parishes are considered by the US EPA to be in NonAttainment, i.e. to not have met the air quality standards for 1-hour ozone, 8-hour ozone, carbon monoxide, or PM-10 pollutants. The US EPA Green Book (http://www.epa.gov/oar/oaqps/greenbk/index.html) was used to generate this dataset. The Green Book data was reviewed May 9, 2006, and this shapefile reflects the data available on May 9, 2006. Per the Green Book documentation, the 1-hour ozone designations were determined June 15, 2005, and the other pollutants were determined as of March 2, 2006. </abstract> <purpose>Mapping</purpose> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>5/2006</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>publication date</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>Annually</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-109.050173</westbc> <eastbc>-88.758389</eastbc> <northbc>37.002328</northbc> <southbc>25.837377</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekey>Nonattainment</themekey> <themekey>1-Hour Ozone</themekey> <themekey>8-Hour Ozone</themekey> <themekey>Carbon Monoxide</themekey> <themekey>PM-10</themekey> <themekey>Atmosphere</themekey> <themekey>Boundaries</themekey> <themekey>Environmental</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekey>Louisiana</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst>None</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>David Parrish</cntper> <cntorg>EPA Region 6</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Coordinator</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>1445 Ross Ave., Ste. 1200</address> <city>Dallas</city> <state>TX</state> <postal>75202</postal> <country>US</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>214-665-8352</cntvoice> <cntemail>parrish.david@epa.gov</cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <browse> <browsen><URL: Nonattainment_LA_EPA_2006.gif></browsen> <browset>GIF</browset> </browse> <datacred>EPA Region 6 GIS Support, EPA Green Book</datacred> <secinfo> <secclass>Unclassified</secclass> </secinfo> <native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722</native> <crossref> <citeinfo> <origin>US EPA</origin> <pubdate>May 9, 2006</pubdate> <title>Green Book Nonattainment Areas for Criteria Pollutants</title> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Washington, DC</pubplace> <publish>USEPA</publish> </pubinfo> <onlink>http://www.epa.gov/oar/oaqps/greenbk/index.html</onlink> </citeinfo> </crossref> </idinfo> <dataqual> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srccite> <citeinfo> <origin>US EPA Office of Air Quality Planning and Standards</origin> <pubdate>June 2005</pubdate> <title>EPA Green Book</title> <onlink>http://www.epa.gov/oar/oaqps/greenbk/</onlink> </citeinfo> </srccite> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>On May 9, 2006, reviewed counties/parishes listed at http://www.epa.gov/oar/oaqps/greenbk/ to determine those included in the 8-hour ozone, 1-hour ozone, CO, and PM-10 nonattainment set. Using the Census Bureau TIGER/Line county coverage, added 4 attributes (fields) to use for determining whether the county/parish was listed as not meeting attainment. A "Y" was placed in each column to designate the county/parish as one not meeting attainment.</procdesc> <srcused>http://www.epa.gov/oar/oaqps/greenbk/</srcused> <procdate>May 9, 2006</procdate> These data have been developed from the best available sources. Although efforts have been made to ensure that the data are accurate and reliable, errors and variable conditions originating from physical sources used to develop the data may be reflected in the data supplied. Users must be aware of these conditions and bear responsibility for the appropriate use of the information with respect to possible errors, scale, resolution, rectification, positional accuracy, development methodology, time period, environmental and climatic conditions and other circumstances specific to these data. The user is responsible for understanding the accuracy limitations of the data provided herein. The burden for determining fitness for use lies entirely with the user. The user should refer to the accompanying metadata notes for a description of the data and data development procedures.  Although these data have been processed successfully on computers at the LOSCO, no guarantee, expressed or implied, is made by LOSCO regarding the use of these data on any other system, nor does the act of distribution constitute or imply any such warranty.
